longQuestions.questionText: State and prove the relationships between roots and coefficients of a quadratic equation. If α and β are roots of 3x² - 4x - 7 = 0, find: (a) α + β, (b) αβ, (c) α² + β², (d) (α - β)². Form a quadratic equation whose roots are (α + 2) and (β + 2).

If α and β are roots of x² + px + q = 0, prove that: (a) α² + β² = p² - 2q, (b) α³ + β³ = -p³ + 3pq. Find the equation whose roots are α²/β and β²/α. Also, if α and β are roots of ax² + bx + c = 0, find the equation with roots (α+1/β) and (β+1/α).
